archdesc.bioghist: Erich Steiner was a professor of botany at the University of Michigan and director of the Matthaei Botanical Gardens (1971-1977, 1989-1991). He received his baccalaureate degree in Botnay from the University of Michigan in 1940, and his Ph.D. in Genetics from Indianna University in 1950. His most notable work was on the evolutionary genetics of Oenothera (Evening Primrose).
archdesc.scopecontent: Material related to Professor Erich Steiner's time as a professor of Botany at the University of Michigan. Includes lists of students, department policies, and historical department documents. Also included are pictures of the Botany Department from 1953.
